Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Scarab
Description: Scarab with succinctly depicted back. The head and clypeus are depicted, the prothorax only indicated by two lateral incisions and the legs but outlined. The flat surface is carved with round spirals ending with flowers; a widespread motif at the end of the Middle Kingdom and the Second Intermediate Period.
